text:
Q: How to finish Tree-sitter plugin in Neovim by Lazy.nvim? A:

I am quite sure that this part:

    },
    config = function(_, opts)
      local ok, configs = pcall(require, "nvim-treesitter.configs")
      if ok then
        configs.setup(opts)
      end
    end

is redundant, try removing it and run the diagnostic again;

Side-Tip: some might consider this bad advice, but generally, it is fine to ignore :checkhealth, unless you specifically are facing issues like in this case; in my experience, as you accumulate plugins, there tend to be a lot of warns etc. that don't have to be 'attended to'; If you are using (and as a beginner you might find this useful, even if only for reference) kickstart.nvim this is also mentioned in the kickstart source:

[[NOTE: Not every warning is a 'must-fix' in `:checkhealth`

  Fix only warnings for plugins and languages you intend to use.
    Mason will give warnings for languages that are not installed.
    You do not need to install, unless you want to use those languages!]]

Best Of Luck with your Neovim Journey!

Q: Recommended workaround for circular import issue? A:

How I think of an import is copy that entire file or part of that file and place it right here it will only happen once at runtime. As for a circular import, the easiest way to replicate that would be if module A import module B, and module B imports module A. Or furthermore Module A imports Module B, C, and X, and one of those Modules imports A.

Q: Dynamic TEMPLATE_DIRS A:

This is simply app-specific templates, which is already catered for by the APP_DIRS flag in the template settings dict. There shouldn't be any other configuration needed.
